repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: insert_at value is not correct when using vim.schedule.

Solution: range insert_at from head of layers to find the place to insert grid.

Fix #18142

comment_data.body:
Sorting is only needed if the grid is already present in the layers.
```suggestion
    bool resort = wp->w_grid_alloc.comp_index != 0
                  && wp->w_grid_alloc.zindex != wp->w_config.zindex;
```
oh thanks
can the existing test be modified? why do we need a separate test?  https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/e36e68d35cfa285b28f4c87782311e913a306c92/test/functional/ui/float_spec.lua#L8388
screen height width is needed to make the position of the two windows clear in the test. Special trigger condition vim.schedule
why can't we just modify the existing test with those changes?

by "modify the existing test", I don't mean to paste the entire new test in the existing test scope. I mean just change the existing test. Why do we need 200 lines of test code? Just change the _existing_ test for z-index behavior so that it uses `vim.schedule` and whatever else.
maybe need reuse and clean . trying..
I don't think `vim.schedule()` is needed, as you are already using `exec_lua()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8434,6 +8434,111 @@ describe('float window', function()
                                                   |
         ]]}
       end
+      command('fclose')
+      exec_lua([[
+        local win1, win3 = ...
+        vim.schedule(function()
+          vim.api.nvim_win_set_config(win1, { zindex = 400, title = 'win_400', title_pos = 'center', border = 'single' })
+          vim.api.nvim_win_set_config(win3, { zindex = 300, title = 'win_300', title_pos = 'center', border = 'single' })
+        end)
+      ]], win1, win3)

comment_data.body: Using different border styles may make the order clearer.

comment_data.body: sound reasonable..

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -101,6 +101,34 @@ bool ui_comp_should_draw(void)
   return composed_uis != 0 && valid_screen;
 }
 
+// Adjusts the position of a layer in the layers array based on its zindex.
+// Moves the layer either forward (if zindex increases) or backward (if zindex decreases).
+//
+// @param[in]  idx       The index of the current layer in the items array.
+// @param[in]  forward   True move forward otherwise move backward.
+void ui_comp_layers_adjust(size_t idx, bool forward)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion

      --
      -- Check that floats are positioned correctly after changing the zindexes.
      --
      command('fclose')
```

what is the primary purpose of this function? is its main purpose to "sync" zindex with comp_index? or is that just a detail, and the main purpose is to raise/lower a layer?

how does it different from `ui_comp_raise_grid` ? (why aren't we using `ui_comp_raise_grid`?)

the answers to the above will help lead to a better name for this function. "adjust" is just meaningless.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -101,6 +101,32 @@ bool ui_comp_should_draw(void)
   return composed_uis != 0 && valid_screen;
 }
 
+// Raises or lowers the layer.
+//
+// @param[in]  layer_idx Index of the layer to be raised/lowered.
+// @param[in]  raise     Raise the layer if true, else lower it.
+void ui_comp_layers_adjust(size_t layer_idx, bool raise)

comment_data.body: new implementation mainly avoids the use of full qsort, updates the order of the window grid in the layers according to the change of zindex, and ensures the correct order when the windows are drawn. zinde can be smaller or bigger than before. ui_comp_raise_grid only handle raise and comp area, layers_adjust just adjust order by zindex
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -101,6 +101,32 @@ bool ui_comp_should_draw(void)
   return composed_uis != 0 && valid_screen;
 }
 
+// Raises or lowers the layer.
+//
+// @param[in]  layer_idx Index of the layer to be raised/lowered.
+// @param[in]  raise     Raise the layer if true, else lower it.
+void ui_comp_layers_adjust(size_t layer_idx, bool raise)

comment_data.body:
> updates the order of the window grid in the layers according to the change of zindex, and ensures the correct order when the windows are drawn.

Ok that sounds like "syncs comp_index with zindex". Right? 

Is the *primary* purpose of the function to raise/lower, or to "sync" comp_index? Please update the docstring and function name, based on that.

   return composed_uis != 0 && valid_screen;
 }
 
+// Raises or lowers the layer.

+// @param[in]  raise     Raise the layer if true, else lower it.
+void ui_comp_layers_adjust(size_t layer_idx, bool raise)

comment_data.body: yes.

+// Raises or lowers the layer, syncing comp_index with zindex.
+//

+//
+// @param[in]  layer_idx  Index of the layer to be raised or lowered.
+// @param[in]  raise      Raise the layer if true, else lower it.

comment_regular_data.body: Rebase and then I guess let's merge this?

title: fix(float): re-sort layers when grid zindex changed
